discipline.name: Potence
discipline.overview: Potence fuels the strength behind a hit, enhancing their strikes to a deceptive degree as a frail kindred decapitates a target with one hit. This vitae-fueled power up goes beyond simply being useful in a fight, as it also enables the user to force their body into actions impossible for most to replicate without it. The Brujah use this power as a lethal weapon to cut short any confrontation they don't want to deal with and crack any skulls in their way. They also utilize their strengths with Presence to sway the crowds through Spark of Rage. While they may still feel a deeper connection to Humanity, in their hands this power is a devastating force. Many Nosferatu hesitate to use this power in front of mortals as it will break their deceptive nature. However, when given no choice they understand better than most clans the need to hit and run. Few Lasombra use this power to feed, instead favoring it for the eradication of an enemy with their hands or ripping through a door to command fear and respect.

level1.name: Fluent Strength
level1.effect: Reroll Blood Surge rouse checks on Strength or Potence rolls

level1.name: Lethal Body
level1.effect: Unarmed attacks do Aggravated Health damage to mortals when used and ignore one level of armor per Potence rating of user

level1.name: Soaring Leap
level1.effect: Leap higher and further than usual
level1.notes: They can move as many meters as three times their Potence rating

level2.name: Prowess
level2.effect: Add Potence rating to their unarmed damage and to feats of Strength, add half their Potence rating (Rounded up) to Melee damage

level2.name: Relentless Grasp
level2.notes: Does not benefit the initial grapple test
level2.source: Vampire: The Masquerade Players Guide, page 79

level3.name: Brutal Feed
level3.effect: Turn feeding into a violent and messy affair that only lasts seconds to Slake the user's Hunger
level3.notes: Against vampires the number of feeding actions is halved (rounded down)

level3.name: Spark of Rage
level3.effect: The user can add their Potence rating to rile or incite a person or crowd to violent actions
level3.notes: Against vampires, the user will roll Manipulation + Potence vs Intelligence + Composure

level3.name: Uncanny Grip
level3.effect: Strengthens their grip on most surfaces, allowing them to climb or hang unsupported
level3.notes: The use of this power leaves obvious traces from the damage caused

level3.name: Wrecker
level3.effect: Double Potence rating when used for feats of strength
level3.notes: It cannot be used against living targets
level3.source: Vampire: The Masquerade Players Guide, page 79

level4.name: Draught of Might
level4.effect: Turn their vitae into a Potence boost for others
level4.notes: Each drinker must take one Rouse Checks worth

level4.name: Crash Down
level4.effect: Deal damage to a small area when using Soaring Leap
level4.notes: If opponents total fail or take 3 or more levels of damage they are knocked down
level4.source: Vampire: The Masquerade Players Guide, page 79

level5.name: Earth Shock
level5.effect: Create a shockwave to throw opponents prone
level5.notes: This can only be used once per scene

level5.name: Fist of Caine
level5.effect: Inflict Aggravated Health damage to mortals and supernatural creatures alike

level5.name: Subtle Hammer
level5.effect: Project the vampire's power in a specific body part
level5.notes: You cannot make another attack in the same move, but body parts that have limited movement receive a four-dice bonus or more
level5.source: Vampire: The Masquerade Players Guide, page 79

amalgams.name: Arms of Ahriman
amalgams.effect: Conjures shadow appendages which the user can control
amalgams.source: Vampire: The Masquerade Chicago by Night, page 294

amalgams.name: Obdurate
amalgams.effect: Maintain footing when hit with a massive force
